    1. Home
      2. /
    2. Display Gallery

    Display Gallery

    Ball and Stick

    The ball and stick rendering type is a standard for chemistry. It shows atoms as spheres (balls) and bonds as cylinders (sticks).

    Cartoon

    A cartoon rendering is used to summarize biomolecule secondary structure.

    Dipole

    Render the molecular dipole moment.

    Force

    The force display can be used in combination with geometry optimization.

    Hydrogen Bond

    The hydrogen bonding display will dynamically compute hydrogen-bonding interactions.

    Label

    Label display will attach text annotations to atoms and bonds. Both atoms and bonds will be labelled. Labels will disappear from objects when they are too fa...

    Overlay

    Polygon

    The polygon display will draw tetrahedra, pyramids, octahedra, etc. for atomic centers. This display option is popular in solid-state structures and reflects...

    Ribbon

    The ribbon display adds a protein backbone visualization. Separate chains in the molecule will have unique colors.

    Ring

    The ring display type will color closed rings.

    Simple Wireframe

    The simple wireframe is a faster, simple version of the (Wireframe) model for better performance on large molecules.

    Sticks

    The sticks (or licorice) display represents only the bonds of the molecule as thick cylinders. Atoms are not generally reflected in the display, but serve as...

    Surface

    The surface display generates the full van der Waals or solvent-accessible surface of the molecule. The surface can be colored with a custom color or mapped ...

    Van der Waals Spheres

    Van der Waals spheres or CPK illustrate all atoms as spheres with a full van der Waals radius.

    Wireframe

    The wireframe view draws a thin line for bonds and a small square dot for atoms.
